It's games like this that make me glad I don't live under a Communist regime. That being said, arresting a farmer for smuggling in one carton of cigarettes is oddly satisfying.

The game breaks up the eye scrambling game at the border station checking information on documents and vehicles by having various events take place like your border post being attacked by rebels or criminal gangs, police assistance, ambushes, and storyline options. There was only 1 bug I encountered where I froze in place on about day 13. This game offers more than I thought it would at first glance, and it's pretty fun using your observational skills to clear vehicles - even though that's not even half of the game.
This game has been on my wish list for 2 years well worth the wait, Its much more than I expected and actually fun
Great game, similar mechanics to papers please but add in searching vehicles and the odd gun fight too.

This is a proper game release. Very few bugs found, ambushes on the roads could be reworked as they are a little too abundant and enemies could drop better loot as well. Additionally the trading system could be a bit better as right now it just seems kind of there. Would also be nice to sell my old crappy guns and all the ammo I get off enemies. Aside from those small issues, the game is very much fun to play. First time I opened the game I went for 6 and a half hours straight. If you enjoyed Papers Please, then this will be very refreshing and fun experience.

Bug Free? No
Perfectly Balanced? Nope
But sure is hella fun to play!

It is such a relief to play a brand new simulator game the day of launch and have it actually work, unlike some other recently launched simulator game... Contraband Police is a fun and challenging game that includes many aspects so that you are not simply doing the mundane vehicle inspections over and over.

Definitely recommend this game and can't wait to see what the developer has in store for future updates!

I can definitely recommend this game. I was in the end able to pick up this game for about $15 and currently at 11 hours of play time and still more to come. So overall which I believe will work out to a $1 an hour for fun, I can not recommend this game enough.

Positives:
-Each character (Newcomer) changes slightly if you restart your day. So its not exactly the same.
-Game gives you time to do your search and I never felt rushed like in Papers Please.
-Upgrades give you a sense of accomplishment and assists your needs at the border station.
-No game breaking Bugs!

Negatives:
-Faces and names don't change much from each Newcomer.
-Smaller bugs can cause you to fail a search (I.E. Car behind pushes subject's vehicle through the gate.)
-Events can make you lose out on your current inspection (I.E. Attack on the Boarder Post)

Awesome game, definitely worth a punt.

Wow, what an absolutely great game! The graphics are great, the missions are varied and fun, the map is decent and immersive. I would highly recommend this game. 

9/10

Really fun game! I absolutely loved the gameplay loop, got 17 hours out of it which was what I expected for the story mode. There's no endless mode yet, but I've read it's planned.

I hope the game will eventually get more content such as : more faces (women?), new vehicles, new rules, new weapons, new outpost upgrades (especially this one since it gives you a feeling of progression and there's not much to do once you're rich and bought everything, one of those upgrades could be a NPC to assist you in your car when going outside), etc. The loop is working well, so more content to expand on it would be awesome! 

When I first played the prologue, I thought the open world wasn't working well with the "papers, please" aspect of the game.. but upon actually playing the full game it's actually very good! It's a nice break to give you other things to do. 

My favorite main story quest in the game has to be the murder investigation one! I love thrillers so it's no surprise that I enjoyed it, but I was really surprised that those quests weren't redundant which I was expecting at first. Not at all, they're varied and don't ever feel the same. Music is also really good.

Here's a small section on what I didn't like:
- Gang attacks in the open world: apparently it's going to get fixed soon, which is good, because there's too many of them for very little reward so it was a bit annoying to me.
- Sniper rifle was such a let down, doesn't seem strong at all and no scope either to facilitate head shots
- I wish smugglers' snake symbol were harder to detect

I'm really nitpicking because I loved the game, would definitely recommend!
not just a papers please game. there is so much more than that. extremely satisfied with my purchase.

On sale the first couple days of launch? Hell yeah! Surpassed expectations set by the demo? Hell yeah! Lots of replay-ability to keep you living the ultimate communist dream? Hell yeah!

The game is quite fun, and addictive. Heavily inspired by Papers, please, but not a boring clone. It's a nice take to it where you do more than just be a border control guard.

There are a few improvements that could be made for sure (contains spoilers):
* Days feel a bit short, even after 8 hours into the game. Sometimes I am done with the drivers and there is plenty of light left 
* The world feels a bit empty. Just hotspot areas have things in it. There is no much life in it other than the drivers driving around and the ambushes.
** Adding some houses, wildlife would make this better
* Some more hotkey options would be nice as well, changing the way you approve or deny an entry (instead of having to talk with the person to do the final decision would be cool to have a hotkey for it and changing the flow where you deliver the documents after, while allowing you to still edit the inspection report after making the decision - similar to what Papers Please does), hotkey to pull up the inspection report for car damage
* A bit more interaction with the guards with fleeing cars: feels odd that they just do nothing to a fleeing car when you have heavy armed guards at your post and paying big bucks for them
* The ambush mechanic should be revamped. It's nice on the first and second encounter, and then just become an annoying thing that can kill your precious cargo (prisoners) when taking them to the quarry (use the downed tree as an ambush instead of randomly popping up dudes shooting at you; add ways to slow you down, maybe lower the firepower but make it more challenging to flee)
* Sometimes it's really hard to spot broken windows in the cars: not sure if I am just blind or if bugged.
* Some drugs are said to be hidden behind the car seat, but in some car layouts it's super hard to spot those

Overall, I'm happy with this game and I hope they keep improving on it and make it even more challenging, just like late game papers please gets. We definitely need more games like Papers please and this game is in a good direction!
6 years in development may sound awful, but when the game is turns out this polished and taken care of, it reminds me when studios used to care about their games <3

It is like papers please but with gang attacks, searching vehicles for contraband, and more.

I'm a fan of Papers, Please and this game scratches the itch that I've longed to have scratched. It is so rewarding to search and find contraband and I really appreciate the developers giving the players freedom to prioritize decisions during daylight hours and also choosing what kind of officer you want to play as. po necelych peti hodinach: je to defakto papers please ale bez davky deprese levelu "vlastimil brodsky posloucha radiohead", ve 3d a na steroidech. mate svuj checkpoint, vylepsujete ho, najimate dalsi personal, ten take levelujete. hra neni omezena jen na zmineny checkpoint ale dostanete se i do jeho okoli, takze zadrzene paseraky budete vozit do kamenolomu, zabaveny tovar na stanici a pro tooly do obchodu (nez si uplatite vlada aby zvedl svuj zauhreny zadek a s pojizdnou prodejnou za vama prijel osobne). zaroven se velice zahy musite rozhodnout jestli budete provladni nebo revolucionar a od toho se odviji ...eee.. sidequesty? nevim jak to popsat :) proste vam po sichte v noci zazvoni telefon a soudruzka vam sdeli ze mate jet tam a tam a pomoct s obranou fizlarny, sledovat podezreleho apod. 
samotne prohledavani aut, kontrolovani deklarovaneho nakladu a lustrace dokumentu je zabavna. je super ze hra neni uplne rougelike takze kdyz vam utece balik s koksem v sedacce, muzete si z vesela restartovat den. a zkusit to znova. 
k dispozici mate nastenku na ktere vam jsou hazeny tipy na paseraky, resp indicie v duchu "paserak goc zvany destovka se pokusi prekonat hranici v sedem aute", "vuz veze drogy, v spz ma 40S", "podezrelemu je 40 let" apod. generuje to zabavne situace kdy jsem jeden den tri sediva auta vylozil a zkontroloval pod lupou a nic, protoze ten debil prijel az dalsi den. 
skoda jen ze nejde vasi posadce rict aby vas treba tento soudruh se samopalem nasledoval na akci, veskere interakce jsou omezeny na "vrat naklad zpatky do auta" a "odklid auto zatceneho z inspekcni plochy". 
sumasumarum: presne ten spravny obskurni a podivny tycoon/simulator ktere mam tak rad. ano jsem divny :) a v multiplayeru by to mohla byt desna pecka, zive vidim jak jeden lustruje doklady zatimco druhy prohledava naklad... uvidime co na to modderi.

What a pleasant surprise !

I was skeptical, but bought it anyway. 

Gosh what a great game. Really refreshing and new approach. It's "Papers, please" taken to next level.

I really like the "puzzle" this games offers. When you have to control many details before you can Approve or Deny entrance. Even then for maximal reward, you have to make sure to note all faulty details in inspection. More details you note, the bigger reward is.  Every time I make a decision, there is uncertainty if i missed something. After chapter II, the amount of things you have to watch out increases a lot. It becomes a mystery game, with a burning question "Did i get all the clues or not?".

Extra part is, you have to arrest correct people, take them to labor camp. Take contrabands to police warehouse, fight gangs who always ambush you when you're driving these two things. Aaaand this is the part where games fails. Gosh this is annoying as heck. The game has gunfights, either on the road or when border crossing is attacked. This part, although a welcomed mix, is really annoying due to how, too simple it is and anti-climatic. 

There is also some detective work, which was done pretty well. But not too hard. 

The map design is also one of it's biggest minuses. It's a bland corridor. You gonna spend a lot of time driving to camp and police station plus to other parts. This drive through canyon looks like a long, identical corridor. Nothing to see except tress and canyon rocks, plus those annoying ambushes.  While I presume this was done to make game less system demanding. The two most used routes to camp and police should still be somewhat more interesting visually. More nature, wide roads, something to make that drive feeling lees like identical corridor. 

However this games shines at you looking at papers and inspecting vehicles. A truly well made game.

Game's fun, what can I say? Graphics could be better, but the lighting covers it up and gives the game a distinct feel. The only  downside(?) is that the game is quite easy, as soon as you get a gun most interactions become trivial. 
Spotting discrepancies in the actual border part isn't much of a challenge, with the only exclusion being the fake passports, but by that point you've upgraded your post enough to be able to scan every passport with the scanner. Despite that, the game does provide a nice challenge closer to the end, with you having to remember all the smuggler hints and remembering to check all 13 possible reasons to reject someone. 
Everything outside of the border post part is mindless and pointless. You have to drive across the entire map to first drop off criminals at the labor camp, and then drop off the contraband at the police station. It's good worldbuilding, but the only gameplay during those parts is the ambushes, which are somehow both really annoying and extremely easy. Closer to the end of the game, you even get the ability to get a house call from the cops, so you don't even have to drive anywhere.
The gunplay is... well.. 4/10 at best. The AK sounds like a 9mm.
Story is nice, but it's not developed to the point that I actually care about characters.
After beating the game, you don't unlock any NG+ features or an Endless mode, which would always be nice, as playing through the same thing again except for 6 diffirent choices in story missions gets really repetitive.
Overall, this game is great and an easy pickup if you loved Papers Please, but it's got some issues that prevent it from being my favorite game.
